name: Macdonald Hill Valley Spa, Hotel & Golf

reviews.title: Good but could be great
reviews.text: There are some really great positives about this hotel. Firstly, the rooms whilst smallish, are nicely appointed. We had a ground floor feature room with a view across the golf course (and a small terrace). If the forecast is good I'd recommend you pay that little bit more for this room. They're South facing so it's nice to sit out in the sun with a drink watching the (golf) world pass by. We played both golf courses. The Emerald course is the better of the two - one of the nicest 'hotel' courses we've played. The other course, Sapphire, is more hilly and let down by perhaps four poor holes and lack of signage. Both courses are walkable but if you fancy a buggy one day use it on Sapphire. The Spa is good if not the best we've seen. The breakfast is excellent. Now for a few negatives. It's a modern red brick built hotel so if you like old fashioned stone country houses this isn't for you. We found the restaurant lacked charm. I'd liken it to Premier Inn. It's certainly not of the standard of some other McDonald Hotels we've stayed in. The evening meal matched the surroundings. Nothing wrong with it but nothing special. There were some nice touches: I liked the fact that the bread was carved freshly at the table. I'd have liked a better wine list (with lower price points). I'd also have liked the opportunity to take coffee in the lounge.
A final niggle: after a round of golf I like a beer and some nuts or crisps. However, the bar offers food but not snacks. A shame in my view.
reviews.title: Golf Break

reviews.text: So, in conclusion, this is a good golf/spa venue and I'd go back. However, I'd keep my restaurant choices simple and expect wholesome 'pub' grub and that way I'd be very pleased.
reviews.title: Very relaxing

reviews.text: Stayed 24 hrs with a group for DB&B and 2 rounds of golf. Surroundings pleasant-staff friendly-bedroom small but OK -clean and adequate-food acceptable but drinks expensive! Two Golf Courses both in need of some mowing and raking - the short course in particular needed some attention. Pleasant stay but not likely to return.
reviews.title: Standards Dropping?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed with a couple of business colleagues after a very busy week, I had a minor issue with room and the young chap on reception sorted it out by moving all my belongings to another room, no fuss no issue. I will be staying again without doubt
reviews.title: Wonderful and peaceful

reviews.text: Me and my mother have been to Macdonald Hill Valley on two occasions and have loved it. The reception staff were very helpful and the rooms are extremely clean, a great size and very comfortable. We had a view on both stays over looking the golf course. The bathroom is beautiful, in good condition and the water was always hot. We had a spa break whereby treatments were included, however we had additional treatments on both stays. During the second stay we had a lunch included which was delicious and healthy. The spa has had a revamp and is a little larger than previously, however this did not spoil the atmosphere. We had full use of the spa, swimming pool and gym.
reviews.title: Amazing Spa Break

reviews.text: We were made to feel very special throughout the entire break, especially during the evening meal. The evening meal was fabulous! We had a three course evening meal included in the stay and breakfast the following morning. We purchased a bottle of wine with the evening meal which was a little pricey! I would definitely choose this hotel again and hope to visit for a spa break some time this year.
reviews.title: Girly spa weekend

reviews.text: Myself and 4 girlfriends went here for a one night spa break on a Saturday night.
reviews.title: Vital Spa

reviews.text: The hotel is very clean and the rooms and bathrooms are lovely and modern. The problem with this hotel is organsation and understaffing. Our brunch took a long time to come and when it did, the boiled eggs were hard not soft like asked and we had to keep asking the poor barman to go and get things eg a spoon fr the eggs instead of a fork, butter for the toast etc.
reviews.title: Great setting and super golf course, but some things could be better

reviews.text: The treatments in the spa were very nice but it was soo busy with lots of hen parties and when we had lunch in the spa lounge, it too forever and the poor lady who took our order said that she was sorry, but the kitchen was the other side of the hotel so when we asked for mayo etc she had to go all the way to the kitchen etc, they definately needed a few extra hands on such a busy day.
reviews.title: Amazing Golf Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To celebrate 25 years together we decided to book a night away and chose this hotel - we are so glad that we did. The staff were brilliant and we were upgraded, free of charge, to a gorgeous room with a bottle of wine for us to enjoy our celebration. The pool is so warm it's like swimming in a bath and we loved the sauna and steam room. We had a fantastic meal in the lounge bar and, yes it was expensive, as were the drinks, but it was a special occasion so we decided to be extravagant!! The cooked breakfast was fairly simple but the cold buffet was amazing with everything you could possibly wish for. The lights in our room fused but they were repaired within minutes once we had reported it to reception so no complaints there. There was a good heater in the room and we could regulate the temperature to our needs. The room overlooked the golf course - just a shame the weather was poor or we would have enjoyed having a drink sitting outside on our little patio. All in all we have had a fantasic time and would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone!
reviews.title: A rare getaway!

reviews.text: I booked a Spa day with my sister and my neice on one of the march offers. It was a fantastic day out and well worth every penny. We had a coffee and bacon bap in the hotel to start our day which was perfect and then we did our Spa which was excellent.
reviews.title: Spa Day

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hmmm! Decided to rest up on our journey home and called in to this hotel, very late in the day. £168 for very basic room with breakfast. Very professional front of house manager-but that's about all I can say in favour of this place. Cold room-- faulty plumbing - wafer thin pillows --and no privacy nets on the ground to ceiling window( we were ground floor, so open for all to see with curtains open). Set in nice grounds with its own golf course, it is obviously well suited for the visiting golfers, who seemed predominantly male and in various sized groups, drinking the day away in their rooms. The restaurant was 'full' ( more staff would clearly help here). And so we were forced to eat in the bar area, surrounded by returning golfers, still wearing the majority of their outdoor clothing. Breakfast was a farce. They were again woefully understaffed, with the previous evenings staff clearly exhausted and some still wearing the same stained clothing from their previous evenings shift. Breakfast food itself was fine-but the service was again painfully slow due to lack of staff. 4 Star ??? -not in my book. Ok for parties, golfing groups and reps-- definitely not the sort of place i would recommend if you are looking for a luxury weekend break.
reviews.title: Bland, overpriced, understaffed and below Travel Lodge standards.
The Sapphire course
reviews.text: Can't comment on the hotel that get great feed back on here anyway we played the sapphire course last weekend and for the price of £12.50 it's was ok but I feel hill valley are missing the trick buy not looking after it in a better way stores in the traps some greens need some TLC and two trees needs cutting down on the 18th (they block the view) on the fairway all it would take is for the green keepers to have a few week of care and that would put it back on track the prices in the bar area are far to high £13 .00 for a pot of coffee !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night 16th Feb. Paid for the Relax and Retreat package. Checked in approx 40 minutes early no problem. Credit Card was swiped for £50, slightly annoying, especially as my attention was drawn to the fact that it had to be a credit card, and that I'd be charged an additional £3 if I settled using a credit card. Seemed a bit of a scam that one. Was advised that my room would 'also be upgraded' which wasn't entirely true as I'd paid for the upgrade. Room was of decent size, the bed was huge, their was water in the room on arrival, and a vey welcome fridge. Room has no air conditioning which proved for a restless night as it was too warm, and couldn't open the patio doors as it was groundfloor so didn't fancy a fox cruising in at 4am and chewing my arm.
reviews.title: Not bad, not great either

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have stayed at several McDonald hotels but never stayed at the Hill Valley Spa. We booked in for my husband's 'special' birthday. All the staff were very welcoming & obliging, and made our stay very enjoyable. We felt nothing was too much trouble from the time we booked in until when we said our goodbyes. The evening meals were excellent, our room was beautiful (we even managed to sit outside and read the papers/watch the golfers in the February sunshine). We will definitely be returning. And would like to say a big thank you to the Management for making our stay and especially my husband's birthday extra special... THANK YOU.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked the Spa and hotel seperate online for a treat for my Fiance for Valentines. The Spa was excellent, we both said it was the best spa we had been to (and we have been to many both in this country and abroad!). The treatments i had (back massage and foot massage) were brilliant and my fiance (back massage and facial) were also fantastic, i can definately reccomend the foot massage. The hotel was great, very frieldy and helpful staff on reception. The room was clean and tidy and quite large with a seperate seating area with 2 old fashioned high back chairs, which were great for a short nap after the spa! The bathroom was spacious with both a bath and seperate shower. We booked dinner, bed & breakfast, the evening meal was fantastic with an excellent parship soup and shoulder of lamb which i would reccomend. We also had our breakfast delivered to the room as this hotel does not charge (£3.00) for this service, although we only had 1 set of cutlery and was missing the toast, this wasnt a problem as we contacted reception and they brought this up very quickly so we coulod enjoy the breakfast and the toast at the same time. All in all an excellent break and will definately be returning especially for the spa treatments!
reviews.title: Valentines Spa Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a 2 night dinner b&b break. First impression looked like an old peoples care home. Nice friendly welcome from reception staff. Room confirmed our thoughts on old peoples home, very drab with a ripped chair & cobwebs, but saying that the bathroom was clean & modern with a lovely shower & large towels. Dinner on both nights was good with staff being friendly but not super efficient. Breakfast was ok. Spa was lovely & very nice treatments. Swimming pool was nice & clean, but would have liked a jaquzzi.
reviews.title: Too noisy!

reviews.text: On the first night we were kept awake by lots of doors banging & a very loud party that went on until 2am!! Eventually the night staff did resolve it. However- at 8.20am we were woken by a very high pitched fire alarm to which we all turned out into the corridoor where another guest said it was a false alarm!. No apology or explanation was given by any staff.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel with fantastic spa and golf

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent two nights here this weekend and were not disappointed. The emerald golf course was great and the spa facilities were excellent! The beauty treatments were perfect and the healthy spa lunch was a great addition! Hotel rooms were modern, clean and spacious. The breakfast was great with lots of choice and dinner was good value and tasted lovely. We had a great weekend and would definitely visit again!
reviews.title: ROMANTIC MEAL FOR 2

aka: Macdonald Hill Valley Hotel, Golf & Country Club Hotel Whitchurch
